data.title: Le corbeau
data.meta_description:

Does anyone know how to translate the title Le corbeau a French film by Clouseau? It does not refer to the bird but to someone who sends threatening...
data.text:
Hello,

Does anyone know how to translate the title Le corbeau a French film by Clouseau? It does not refer to the bird but to someone who sends threatening letters.

Thank you very much for your help.

en anglais:

For some reason it's been packaged here as "The Raven", but its better known title is "Le Corbeau", or "The Crow."

(writer of poison-pen letters)

Thank you very much.

In a short story by Shirley Jackson, a woman sends letters to people in order ' to wipe out some of the evil' would you call her 'a crow' or 'a raven'?

She's not really looking for money.

Hello,

Does anyone know how to translate the title Le corbeau a French film by Clouseau? It does not refer to the bird but to someone who sends threatening letters.

Thank you very much for your help.

Clouzot

hello

In 'argot' French slang, un corbeau is someone who sends poison-pen letters which is what the film is about. Shot in the early 40's it was regarded as a metaphor for'some' French people during WW2. As for the birds there are very few ravens in France.
